Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
lobotomy
1. What a hacker subjected to formal management training is said to have undergone. At {IBM} and elsewhere this term is used by both hackers and low-level management; the latter doubtless intend it as a joke.
2. The act of removing the processor from a {microcomputer} in order to replace or upgrade it. Some very cheap {clone} systems are sold in "lobotomised" form - everything but the brain.
[{Jargon File}]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
lobotomy \lobotomy\ n. (Med., Surgery) The surgical interruption of nerve tracts to and from the frontal lobe of the brain, by cutting into the brain.
Syn: prefrontal lobotomy, prefrontal leucotomy. [WordNet 1.5]

lobotomy n. 1. What a hacker subjected to formal management training is said to have undergone. At IBM and elsewhere this term is used by both hackers and low-level management; the latter doubtless intend it as a joke. 2. The act of removing the processor from a microcomputer in order to replace or upgrade it. Some very cheap {clone} systems are sold in `lobotomized' form -- everything but the brain.

lobotomy n : surgical interruption of nerve tracts to and from the frontal lobe of the brain; often results in marked cognitive and personality changes [syn: {leukotomy}, {leucotomy}, {prefrontal lobotomy}, {prefrontal leukotomy}, {prefrontal leucotomy}, {frontal lobotomy}]
